column4: I have radvd installed, but I dont want it to start on boot. How can I achieve this?
How can I set it so it doesnt start on boot?
either disable it in /etc/init if its ran by upstart. or in /etc/rc2.d if its handled by the sysv system
state the connection type. Wired or wireless..
has any live cd's worked with networking?
that is very very odd then, Hmm any idea what NIC you got?
could be theres some kernel module youi need to load. How old is this machine?
the machine is about 2 years old, i think. maybe a bit more...
see if dmesg output mentions the network cards at all. i had a Marvell NIC that the kernel dident like too well
what can i search for in /var/log/dmesg to see if it found NIC?
not sure what pattern to sue
there were some alternatives to screen. that worked basically the same way. but i cant recall their names. 'twin' used tobeone . but i dont think its in the repos any more
what iso did you put on the flash drive? Server? alternative? xubuntu desktop?
ubuntu 9.04 server
thats the problem then.. server cant do a flash-drive type install
none of the server editions?
none that i know of.
i see this asked in here about 3 times a week. its possibel there may be  a way to do it with grub2 and booting the iso file. but ive never tried
do you know of any way to install a server edition without a cD?
might've missed your response, or you might've missed my question. is there any way to install ubuntu server without using a CD?
perhaps grub2 booting the iso file.. or a netboot.
